text: Lovell is an unincorporated community in Wyandot County, Ohio. ==History== Lovell was founded in the 1870s soon when the railroad was extended to that point. A post office was established at Lovell in 1877, and operated until 1909. The community was named for its founder, Lovell B. Harris. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Ohio
title: Lovell, Ohio
